text: [Music]
I'm Karthik I'm the CTO at the lower
group
I am also love the original co-founders
nor as a single headquartered Southeast
Asian online fashion business we have
about 1500 people across these markets
that we serve and redundant in the
business of selling clothes shoes and
handbags to men and women in their 20s
or early 30s so we're at this point we
have an active app install base of 20
million users in Southeast Asia for us I
think our key mission statement is
fashion on-demand 24/7 as quickly and as
conveniently as the customer ones at at
her doorstep if necessary in the blink
of an eye and you know this encompasses
the entire customer and brand promise
that then is delivered to that platform
that we run on Amazon Web Services we
move to the cloud and AWS primarily
because you know the business was
growing at an average of one percent in
the first three four years of our
existence in the physical server world
you have to manage your own backups you
have to manage your own failover you
have to clean up logs on your server it
it does get quite cumbersome all of this
gets in the way of being a very nimble
agile fast startup company that is able
to match demand with supply and for us
Amazon Web Services allowed us to do
that without something dramatic in the
blink of an eye
we outgrew for the server world offered
to us and it was just the right time for
us to switch over and very provided like
handsome senses so I think with AWS
we've managed to nail auto-scaling
really well on Amazon ec2 so we we don't
really worry about how much traffic we
get because the platform just scales
horizontally as and when demand
increases the main things that we use
able is for all of our customer facing
technology runs on AWS so the solar ios
app the Android app the product catalog
search facility checkout payments all of
that runs in AWS in addition to that all
of our back-end systems run on
interviewer so our warehouse is run our
software which running enable to take
back ship inbound outbound
the absolute nuts and bolts of retail
they all run in the cloud we don't spend
a single dollar on service for the last
16 months and we're completely on AWS we
use Amazon ec2 redshift s3 and RDS with
AWS lambda one of the examples of how we
use these services together is our
operational data warehouse which are
buying marketing and operations teams
look at pretty much in real time for
sales ops KPIs and other key metrics
that allow us to run the business on a
day to day basis you know my DevOps team
which runs the tech infrastructure is
three people for all of the scale that
we run my data warehouse team that does
all of the reporting on the platform
side is four people typically you'd
expect for for something like 300 ec2
instances of it compute equivalent of
that in the server world you'd need a
team of 10 or 15 engineers to management
to where we're able to stay very light
and nimble on this one one of the key
metrics I focus on from the tech side is
what is the utilization of my
infrastructure with AWS where we're able
to live on the edge with something like
a 60% utilization for the most part and
the rest of it is our risk tolerance I
would say that our infrastructure spend
has stayed constant and is actually
dropping is one of the biggest amounts
of money we spend as a tech company and
one of our internal goals is to keep
cutting that and Amazon Web Services
really helps us achieve that one of the
metrics we always look at is what is the
average page speed on a typical
e-commerce page if there is a clear
tangible benefit to the end customer by
using a cloud provider that is able to
scale as far as it abuses gives us the
option ality that we normally wouldn't
have in a physical hosting set up with
Amazon Web Services is for us their
primary and the only choice for cloud
services for the foreseeable future
